episodeTitle: The Nightmare Draws Near! Secret Base of the Suna Suna Clan
episodeTitleJapanese: 悪夢の時迫る！ここは砂砂団秘密基地
episodeTitleRomanized: Akumu no toki hakaru! Koko wa Sunasunadan himitsu kichi
description: Luffy battles Crocodile for the third time using his own blood to overcome the Warlord's sand powers, while Vivi discovers the bomb threatening Alubarna and confronts Mr. 7 and Miss Father's Day at the clock tower. The Straw Hats race against time as the countdown to the bomb's detonation continues with only minutes remaining.

events.title: Third Battle Between Luffy and Crocodile Begins
events.description: In the underground tomb, Luffy confronts Crocodile for the third and final time. Having learned from his previous defeats, Luffy prepares to use a new strategy against the Warlord of the Sea.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of the climactic battle that will determine the fate of Alabasta. Unlike the first two battles where Luffy was soundly defeated, this time he has a fighting chance.

events.title: Luffy Uses Blood to Strike Crocodile
events.description: Luffy demonstrates remarkable strategic thinking by using his own blood to coat his fists, allowing him to strike Crocodile despite his Logia-type Sand Devil Fruit powers. The blood hardens Crocodile's sand body, making him vulnerable to physical attacks.
events.significance: This showcases Luffy's growth and adaptability in battle. Without access to Haki (which hasn't been introduced yet), Luffy finds an ingenious solution to overcome a seemingly invincible opponent. This foreshadows his future ability to find creative solutions against powerful enemies.

quotes.text: Water wasn't the only thing that could harden your sand!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy reveals his strategy of using blood to strike Crocodile

events.title: Crocodile Reveals His Poison Hook
events.description: Crocodile removes the golden covering from his hook to reveal a hidden poisonous hook underneath. He uses this deadly weapon against Luffy, viewing it as an honorable way to finish a worthy opponent.
events.significance: This reveals another layer of Crocodile's combat abilities and shows his respect for Luffy as an opponent. The poison adds a critical time element to the battle, as Luffy must defeat Crocodile before the poison spreads through his body.

quotes.text: You've earned the right to die by my most deadly weapon.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile reveals his poison hook to Luffy

events.title: Luffy Gets Poisoned by Crocodile's Hook
events.description: Crocodile's poison hook strikes Luffy, injecting scorpion venom into his body. Despite the poison beginning to spread and numb his body, Luffy continues to fight, showing his incredible willpower and determination.
events.significance: This demonstrates Luffy's extraordinary resilience and foreshadows his unusual resistance to poisons. Crocodile himself notes confusion about why the venom isn't working as effectively as it should, hinting at Luffy's unique physiology.

quotes.text: It's over now. The poison will spread throughout your body.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: After successfully poisoning Luffy with his hook

events.title: Vivi Discovers the Bomb in the Clock Tower
events.description: Using her childhood memories of Alubarna, Vivi deduces that the bomb must be hidden in the clock tower. She arrives to find the bomb with a timer counting down, threatening to destroy the entire city center with a 5-kilometer blast radius.
events.significance: This discovery splits the climax into two parallel storylines - Luffy fighting Crocodile underground and Vivi racing to stop the bomb above ground. Both must succeed to save Alabasta.

quotes.text: The clock tower! That's the only place it could be!
quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi realizes where Crocodile hid the bomb

events.title: Mr. 7 and Miss Father's Day Debut
events.description: The Baroque Works sniper pair Mr. 7 and Miss Father's Day appear at the clock tower, guarding the bomb. Mr. 7 wields his Yellow Gun that fires dice-shaped bullets, while Miss Father's Day uses her Gero Gero Gun that fires frog-shaped projectiles.
events.significance: These Frontier Agents represent the last line of defense for Crocodile's plan. Their specialized sniper abilities make them formidable opponents for Vivi.

quotes.speaker: Miss Father's Day
quotes.context: Miss Father's Day's distinctive laugh as she appears

events.title: Vivi Confronts Mr. 7 and Miss Father's Day
events.description: Princess Vivi prepares to fight Mr. 7 and Miss Father's Day to reach the bomb. Despite being outnumbered and facing specialized combat agents, she stands her ground to protect her kingdom.
events.significance: This battle showcases Vivi's growth from a passive princess to an active fighter willing to risk her life for Alabasta. It also demonstrates her determination to stop the civil war by any means necessary.

quotes.text: I won't let you destroy my country!
quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi confronts the Baroque Works agents

events.title: Nami and Chopper Find Vivi and Usopp
events.description: Nami and Tony Tony Chopper catch up with Vivi and Usopp at the clock tower with only two minutes remaining before the bomb detonates. The Straw Hats prepare to support Vivi in stopping the catastrophe.
events.significance: This reunion brings more of the crew together and emphasizes the race against time. Multiple crew members converging shows the coordinated effort to save Alabasta.

events.title: Zoro and Sanji Reach the Clock Tower
events.description: With only 30 seconds remaining on the bomb timer, the clock tower opens to reveal Mr. 7 and Miss Father's Day laughing inside. Zoro and Sanji arrive at the scene, ready to assist in stopping the bomb.
events.significance: The arrival of the crew's strongest fighters adds to the tension and shows that all the Straw Hats are working together to save Alabasta. The countdown reaching 30 seconds heightens the urgency dramatically.

themes.description: Both Luffy and Vivi demonstrate extraordinary determination to save Alabasta. Luffy fights through poison, while Vivi faces trained assassins to protect her kingdom.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's use of his own blood represents his willingness to sacrifice himself for his friends and their dreams. The ticking clock represents time running out for peaceful resolution.

themes.description: Luffy shows remarkable growth in his tactical thinking by discovering that blood can substitute for water against Crocodile's sand powers.
themes.symbolism: This represents Luffy's evolution from a simple brawler to a more thoughtful combatant who can adapt to seemingly impossible situations.

themes.description: Multiple characters risk their lives to save Alabasta. Luffy pushes through poison, Vivi fights despite being outmatched, and the entire crew races against time.
themes.symbolism: The bomb with its countdown timer symbolizes the destructive consequences of Crocodile's ambition and the high stakes of failure.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the fight sequences and adds more reaction shots from other characters to increase tension and runtime.
Additional scenes showing the Straw Hats converging on the clock tower are expanded in the anime for pacing.

trivia.fact: This is the first time in the series that Luffy uses his own blood as a weapon strategy, foreshadowing his future adaptability in combat.
Crocodile's poison hook is rarely seen throughout the series, with this being one of the few times he uses it, suggesting he reserves it for opponents he deems worthy.
The episode title refers to the 'Suna Suna Clan,' which is the Japanese name for Crocodile's organization (Suna Suna meaning Sand Sand, referencing his Devil Fruit).
Ryūzaburō Ōtomo, Crocodile's Japanese voice actor, is known for voicing villainous characters due to his deep, menacing voice.
The ending theme 'Shining ray' by Janne da Arc features animation of the Straw Hats seeking shelter from rain, which was later reused in the opening 'Hikari e' with Robin added to the crew.
